ygData.subject: Re: A Request and Thoughts on Rubicite Armor.
ygData.msgSnippet: Michael (or anyone else), Ok, need some advice on the Ghoul Lord. Our Guild, pretty much nightly, has 6 people levels 35-49 head down and clear the whole area
ygData.messageBody:
Michael (or anyone else),

Ok, need some advice on the Ghoul Lord.

Our Guild, pretty much nightly, has 6 people levels 35-49 head down and
clear the whole area UP TO The Ghoul Lord. By the time we reach him, all
that is left is 2 Bok Knights, The Ghoul Lord, and his pet.

Just HOW TOUGH is the Ghoul Lord? Is there another critter he can be
equally compared to? How about the Bok Knights? Any suggestions? Can the
Boks be pulled singly?

Thanks for any input,

Tallonn - 36th Verse
Bertox
-----Original Message-----
From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas) <Michael.Garramone@...>
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com' <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Saturday, July 24, 1999 4:05 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] A Request and Thoughts on Rubicite Armor.


>From: "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)" <Michael.Garramone@...>
>
><snip>
>
>> So, we have an armor that is arguably the best magical armor that
>> can be had, for more than half of the players in EQ. (Yes,
>> Mithril and
>> a few other pieces are better but are only wearable by a few, for
>> example we bards cannot wear Mithril). And, it is only found in one
>> place. And, it is a rare drop. What this means is that there will
>> NEVER be enough ruby to go around.
>
>Bards can wear mithril breastplate and the bracers. Never seen any other
>pieces, haven't gone in deep enough yet.
>
><snip>
>
>> Note: if Green Splinted Platemail (like
>> Aradune wears)
>> makes it into the game, and is wearable by those who can wear ruby and
>> by monks also (like it is rumored to), then green will replace ruby as
>> the best armor in the game, and will be camped like hell, not solving
>> the problem at all.]
>>
>
>Being as good as it is, it is going to be on something over level 50,
>requiring at least 2 full groups of level 45-50 players, maybe more, and it
>is hard to coordinate that kind of camp. i have a tough time getting a
>ghoul lord group together until late at night, which takes 6 to 12 people
to
>be safe, and have yet to go and find it already camped.
>
>Shada Silverleaf, Level 50 Bard, Mithaniel Marr
>Erisi, Level 12 Paladin, Mithaniel Marr
>
